Articles.Content:
Name: Argus

Type: Asteroid

Radius: 50 meters

Mass: -50 kilograms

Shape: 4th dimensional equivalent of a dodecahedron

Composition: Rock & solid hydrogen & liquid argon

Surface gravity: 4,000,000,000,000,000 (4 quadrillion) G's

Orbit: Inside Jool's atmosphere

SOI: 5 light years

Orbital speed: 5 microns per 50 years

Rotation period: 3 seconds

Rotation direction: Retrograde

Atmospheric constituents: Stable 5th-dimensional Anti-strangelet matter

Atmospheric pressure -500 ATM

Surface temperature: Negative Absolute zero

History: Argus was first formed when i was messing around with programming, and just decided to repeatedly slam my forehead into my keyboard. The resulting spam inserted into the planetary parameters was Argus!

Edited December 2, 2014 by Souper
Not strange enough if it does not have negative temperature.

Wait, wasn't the surface temperature -0 K just a few minutes ago? That was, in my opinion, way better than "Absolute zero"! Other than that, awesome. I demand that that planet be put into the game. Not only KSP, but every other game as well. Including board games and The Game (I just lost The Game).

EDIT: Proposed addition to History: "Another popular hypothesis on its formation is that Argus was created when the Kraken sneezed a bit too hard."

Edited December 2, 2014 by Mr_Brain
Yeah, and Argus should be the long lost brother of Kerbin, that would be so awesome!

On a sidenote, I wonder if having a planet inside another planets atmosphere is possible with KSP's technical limitations. And if THAT planet has an atmosphere, how would it determine which atmosphere to use?

someone test with hyperedit plz
